page.title: 14Administration in St. John
page.content: Jersey is divided into 12 districts known as{Parishes.}For administrative purposes a number of officials is elected to serve terms of office which vary. At their head is the{"Connetable,"}the Constable who is often called the {"father"}of the Parish. The{"Procureurs du Bien Public"}are the trustees who oversee the{financial {affairs}of the Parish. The{Honorary Police}are responsible for{law and order}as well as the collection of the{Parish Rate. Members of the{Roads Committee}and {Inspectors}look after the{by-roads. All decisions affecting the{Parish}are made at regular{Parish Assemblies attended by Parishioners and held in the{Parish Hall.
